currency.description: Currency to charge in (gbp, usd, eur)

products.description: Map of SKUs to quantity to add to the checkout

ttl.description:
TTL of the token in seconds
Default to 1 months
Max 1 year

currentMode.description: Indicates last known device state. 0 = awake, 1 = sleep, 6 = flight mode

imsi.description: International Mobile Subscriber Identity (A unique number associated with every GSM mobile phone subscriber, which is maintained on a SIM)

knownDevices.description: (optional) Bluetooth MAC addresses of other devices known to this device

ownerId.description: ID of the user which owns this device

users.description: (optional) User IDs associated with this device

uwbId.description: UWB Address as 32bit number (ID based on the silicon inside the device)

alertAction.description:
What to do when the button is pressed or the unit is dropped. Options are:
'available' (stay registered on the mobile network),
'nothing' (one transmission) and
'lockOn' (keep transmitting at 'interval' until instructed otherwise

behavior.description: Char Bitfield with various flags. Advanced use only.

command.description: Internal use. Sends command to device on next connection

debounce.description:
Movement sensitivity on a scale of 1 to 10, with 1 being the most sensitive.
It is correlated to the number of consecutive milliseconds the acceleration needs to exceed the movementSensitivity threshold

flashTryCount.description: Internal use. Set to 0 when changing otaFW

forceFw.description:
Internal use only
Used with otaFW. Set to true to force the unit to upgrade on next connection (rather than waiting for a sleep connection)

fwChannel.description: The firmware channel to use for OTA updates. If null, the unit will use the default channel.

gpsCheckInterval.description: If a safe-zone is used, how often to check the wifi & gps to see if its still inside it (only applies when motion is detected)

gpsStabilize.description:
How long to let the GPS stabilise in seconds once a lock is achieved before sending the position.
Higher values may increase accuracy.

gpsTimeout.description: How long to let the GPS searches for a lock in seconds before giving up. Max 255s.

homeWifiNetwork.description: WiFi network name to use as a Safe-zone. When this network is visible, stay asleep

interval.description: The wake mode interval in seconds. The unit will connect to the server this often when awake.

modeControl.description: Char Bitfield with various flags. Advanced use only.

modeControl2.description: Char Bitfield with various flags. Advanced use only. FW >= 69.

modified.description: Non null dates indicate the configuration will be pushed to the device when it next connects

movementSensitivity.description:
A secondary debounce value. Typically this value is lower or equal to debounce, representing increased
sensitivity to movement once the device is already moving.

movementSensitivityOld.description:
Deprecated. See debounce.
movementSensitivity threshold in terms of units of gravity. We used to adjust it, but a better way of doing it was the amount of times over that threshold (that what debounce is)
Should always be 1, which means... debounce when already moving

otaFW.description: Pending Firmware version. If non null, the unit will be told to upgrade to this version when it next transmits in sleep mode.

packing.description:
The number of GPS points to send with each transmission.
A packing setting of 3 with an 'interval' of 60s will result in points recorded approximately every 20s, but they will only be sent together.

receivedAt.description: The last time the settings were sent to the device

reset.description:
Non NULL values cause unit to restart on next connection
0 = Normal reboot
1 = Clear settings cache and restart
2 = Clear cache and bluetooth connection data, then restart

sleepInterval.description: Sleep mode interval in seconds. The unit will try to connect this often to the server when asleep

stopTimeout.description: The total amount of time in seconds the unit has to be stationary for before deeming the journey over and switching to sleep mode

timed.description: Timed update settings. Must be array of objects matching [{hh: number, mm: number, day: number, action: number}, ...] format

tolerancePercentage.description: Power budget in mAh per location update. Default 10, do not set lower than 5.

transmitTimeout.description:
When the unit first wakes up from sleep, how long to wait before trying to transmit in multiples of 30 seconds.
0 = instant, 1 = 30s, 2 = 60s...
Useful to avoid detection or draining battery inside shielded buildings.

wakeAction.description:
Internal Use Only.
What to do when the unit wakes up (ie is moved and not in a safe-zone).
Options are 'available' (lost and found), and 'normal' (tracking)

availability.description:
The availability of the update
0 - No update available, or no priority given to the update
2 - Update available (minor or un-important), Device may check-in to download if it wants to
4 - Update available (major), Device may check-in to download, could be useful, but not critical
6 - Update available (critical), Device will check-in to download, this is critical and should be done ASAP
9 - Force check-in (maybe an update, maybe not...)

build.description:
A build to update to now.
Can be specific, such as 123, or a special value such as "latest"
If passed with a channel, the build must be available in that channel

channel.description: Channel to to use for future updates for the device

_forceFW.description: Legacy field, will be removed in the future

pending.description:
Pending firmware, as decided by the firmware update system
If a specific firmware has been requested, this is likely to be the same as the requested firmware
Otherwise it is the firmware that the device has been told to update to, perhaps due to new channel releases or other defaults

updateAvailability.description: Value indicating the importance of checking the bootserver for possible FW updates (for the device)

updateRedirects.description: Number of times the device has been told to check the bootserver for possible FW updates, since the last successful update, or FW request

outline.description:
List of {lat:x,lng:y} objects representing the vertices of the polygon.
Not to be used with center and radius.

radius.description: For circular geofences, the radius of the circle in meters. Property is ignored if outline != null.

GeofencePoint.description: For circular geofences, the center {lat:x,lng:y}. Property is ignored if outline != null.

outline.description:
List of {lat:x,lng:y} objects representing the vertices of the polygon.
Not to be used with center and radius.

radius.description: For circular geofences, the radius of the circle in meters. Property is ignored if outline != null.

refreshable.description: Generate a refresh token, which expires this many seconds after the access token expiry. Max 31 days

username.description: TODO convert to email instead of username before publishing auth routes...

refreshToken.description: Optional: Single use refresh token, if refreshable is set

refreshTokenExpiry.description: Optional: Expiry of the refresh token, if refreshable is set

userId.description: User ID of the logged in user

consumedByDeviceId.description:
DEPRECATED, i favour of deviceId
Will continue being returned until at least Mid 2025

consumedOn.description: Date the plan has been consumed, if null then it has not been consumed

creditRemainingDays.description:
If the plan is removed, should the remaining days be credited back to the user account?
Often the case when plan upgrades have happened

deviceId.description: The device that has consumed the plan, if it has been consumed

needsPayment.description:
Flag recording if payment may still be needed for this ordered plan
It may have been assigned before payment, such as for resellers

orderId.description: Order that the plan is associated with, if already paid via a regular order

removedOn.description:
Date the plan has been removed from a device, can be used to detect partially consumed plans
This might also just be the end of the month

userId.description: User that has ordered the plan

totalElements.description: Total elements in the database for given filters

totalPages.description: Total pages of elements given limit and filters

totalElements.description: Total elements in the database for given filters

totalPages.description: Total pages of elements given limit and filters

totalElements.description: Total elements in the database for given filters

totalPages.description: Total pages of elements given limit and filters

totalElements.description: Total elements in the database for given filters

totalPages.description: Total pages of elements given limit and filters

totalElements.description: Total elements in the database for given filters

totalPages.description: Total pages of elements given limit and filters

onoWhitelistId.description:
Connectivity *string `json:"connectivity"`
Group        string  `json:"group"`
ResellerID *int32 `json:"resellerId"`
ResellerPlanID *int32  `json:"resellerPlanId"`
Archived *int32 `json:"archived"`
PlanType       string  `json:"planType"`

wakeLimit.description:
Term           string  `json:"term"`
Price          float64 `json:"price"`
Currency       string  `json:"currency"`
OwnerID        int32   `json:"ownerId"`

eur.description: breaks:  example:"[0,1.99],[10,1.89]"` // Array of quantity to price in EUR

gbp.description: breaks:   example:"[1,2.34],[10,2.22]"` // Array of quantity to price in GBP

usd.description: breaks:   example:"[1,4.35],[10,4.26]"` // Array of quantity to price in USD

deviceIdentifiers.description: Device identifiers - currently only numerical IDs are supported

ignoreSubscriptionSetup.description: Optional ignoring of subscription setup for non reseller users.

planId.description: Plan ID to be assigned to the devices if available

renewOnto.description: Plan ID that the device should automatically renew onto in future billing cycles

renewUntil.description: Optional date, at which the devices will deactivate and plans will not be renewed

ignoreSubscriptionSetup.description:
Optional ignoring of subscription setup for non reseller users.
If the user has the plan already purchased, then don't setup a card or subscription if it does'nt exist...
Subscriptions are already ignored for reseller users, so this option would not be needed for them.

planId.description: Plan ID to be assigned to the device if available

renewOnto.description: Plan ID that the device should automatically renew onto in future billing cycles

renewUntil.description: Optional date, at which the device will deactivate and plans will not be renewed

QCEventMap.description: (optional) QC Events keyed by QC code

refreshable.description: A new refresh token will be generated, with an expiry this many seconds after the access token expiry. Max 31 days

userId.description: User ID of the logged in user

_stripeSubscriptionId.description: (legacy) Stripe Subscription ID for per device subscriptions

count.description: Number of these plans that have either been consumed, or are available for use by devices.

subscriptions.description: Number of devices that have an active subscription to this plan.

hasBillingInfo.description:
Does the user have billing info stored (a card) for potential use in automatic billing?
This does not mean that there is actually an active subscription

parameters.description: Optionally provide parameters as a JSON object in this header. X-Query values take precedence over query parameters for any overlapping fields.
parameters.name: X-Query

put.description:
Sets the plan for multiple devices simultaneously. This is more efficient than individual requests and helps avoid deadlocks when setting plans for reseller devices.
For user devices, the user must have already purchased or been allocated the target plan for each device.
For reseller devices, "unpaid" plans will be created and billed on the next cycle.
Currently only supports device identifiers as numerical IDs.
put.summary: Sets plans for multiple devices in bulk

get.description:
Gets plans that are available for the provided devices.
If multiple devices are provided, only plans that are available to all devices will be returned.

parameters.description: Comma separated device identifiers (serial, imei, id, etc.)
parameters.name: deviceIdentifiers

parameters.description: Optionally provide parameters as a JSON object in this header. X-Query values take precedence over query parameters for any overlapping fields.
parameters.name: X-Query

get.summary: Gets plans that are available for devices
Gets the current firmware of a device

delete.summary: Removes a request for a firmware update on a device

get.summary: Gets the current update that is queued for a device

post.summary: Requests that a device be updated to the given firmware channel and or version

delete.description:
Removes the active plan from the device, recording the date it was removed, so that partial plan usage can be deducted during billing.
A removed plan can not be re added to a device, and a new plan has to be used.
This action will cause the device to be deactivated.

get.description: Gets the current plan of a device, if it has one.

put.description: Sets the plan that the device is currently using, and optionally the plan that it should renew onto. For user devices, the user must have already purchased or been allocated the target plan, and it should be available in their plan pool, see GET /users/plans For reseller devices, an "unpaid" plan will be used, and billed on the next cycle. If the device was previously deactivated, this action will also activate the device.

ignoreSubscriptionSetup.description:
Optional ignoring of subscription setup for non reseller users.
If the user has the plan already purchased, then don't setup a card or subscription if it does'nt exist...
Subscriptions are already ignored for reseller users, so this option would not be needed for them.

planId.description: Plan ID to be assigned to the device if available

renewOnto.description: Plan ID that the device should automatically renew onto in future billing cycles

renewUntil.description: Optional date, at which the device will deactivate and plans will not be renewed

delete.summary: Deletes a tag of a device

put.summary: Updates or creates a device tag

post.description: Purchases plans for the user, adding them to the users plan pool
Claims a device for the user, adding it to your account

Login and receive an access token for future requests.
Optionally receive a refresh token for future access token generation.
Logout and invalidate the current access token.

get.description: List personal access tokens of the user

post.description: Mint a new personal access token for the user
post.summary: Create a new personal access token

delete.description: Delete a personal access token by ID

get.description: Gets plans that are available for a user (already purchased or allocated)

parameters.description: Filter by plans that have already been consumed by devices or not
parameters.name: consumed

parameters.description: Filter by device ID, multiple device IDs can be passed as a comma separated list
parameters.name: deviceId

parameters.description: Filter by plan id, multiple plan IDs can be passed as a comma separated list
parameters.name: planId

Gets a summary of plans for a user (already purchased or allocated)
This can list unused, and used plans with the `consumed` query parameter

parameters.description: Filter by plans that have already been consumed by devices or not
parameters.name: consumed

post.description: Refresh the access token and refresh token that was retrieved during login.

parameters.description: User ID. 0 can be used for the current user

delete.description:
Deletes a geofence list
This can be a list that you have created, or a list that has been shared with you.

get.description:
Gets a geofence list
This can be a list that you have created, or a list that has been shared with you.

post.description:
Shares a geofence list with a user
This can be a list that you have created, or a list that has been shared with you.

delete.description:
Deletes a user from a geofence list
Anyone that has access to the list (via sharing) can alter the users that have access to it

parameters.description: User ID. 0 can be used for the current user
parameters.name: userid

parameters.description: User ID to add to the list
parameters.name: targetid

delete.summary: Removes a user from a geofence list

put.description:
Adds a user to a geofence list
Anyone that has access to the list (via sharing) can alter the users that have access to it

parameters.description: User ID. 0 can be used for the current user
parameters.name: userid

parameters.description: User ID to add to the list
parameters.name: targetid

put.summary: Adds a user to a geofence list

delete.summary: Deletes a geofence from a list

put.summary: Puts a geofence on a list

parameters.description: Filter by plans that have already been consumed by devices or not
